explanation: Agent A is correct in the sense that the shown code calls strchr(args, '&') and strchr(args, '=') on the incoming char *args without any guarantee in the function body that args points to a NUL-terminated string. strchr() scans until it finds a '\0' and therefore will read memory beyond the underlying object if the caller supplies a non NUL-terminated buffer or a pointer into an object that does not contain a terminating NUL before the object end. MISRA C:2023 Rule 21.17 prohibits uses of <string.h> routines that can result in accesses beyond the bounds of the referenced objects. Unless there is an externally documented and enforced precondition (API contract) that args is a valid NUL-terminated C string, the code can violate Rule 21.17. (If such a precondition exists and is guaranteed by all callers, the usage is acceptable.)
